data.name: Marion County Commission on Youth (MCCOY)
data.description:
MCCOY champions the positive development of youth through community and systems change. Our vision is that every young person has equitable opportunities to learn, grow, and thrive. As an intermediary, we accomplish our mission through our four critical roles:

ADVOCATE: working with youth to help them talk about issues that matter to them and speaking out on behalf of youth about youth issues.

RESOURCE: providing data, information, strategic knowledge and promising success strategies. 

CAPACITY BUILDER: showing those who work with youth how to use their skills to become more competent and effective.

CONNECTOR: assembling various groups in our community that play key roles in a youth's success.

Working in these roles MCCOY creates positive outcomes for youth and supports policies that provide young people with the opportunities they need to succeed both now and in the future.
data.enriched_summary: MCCOY is a company that champions the positive development of youth through leadership on key issues and support of the youth worker community.
data.metadata_title: MCCOY – We champion the positive development of youth through leadership on key issues and support of the youth worker community.

School may be back in session & summer coming to a close, but we'd like to remember kicking off our Summer Youth Program season with an amazing Director's Mixer in April. The seasons change, but we'll be back next year to help Indy do summer camps right!
#tbt #throwbackthursday #summeryouthprograms #youthwork

Congratulations to all this year's winners of the Excellence in Summer Service Awards. Join us as we celebrate these young people's amazing accomplishments! #youthwork #summercamp #summeryouthprograms

Proud is just not enough to express how excited I am for Elizabeth (aka Goose) on receiving the Excellence in Summer Service Award from Marion County Commission on Youth (MCCOY)! I am truly honored to get the privilege of supervising our young people and being one of the first steps in their career journey. 

Girl Scouts of Central Indiana is so proud of you, Goose!

Yesterday, I was truly honored to have been awarded the Certificate of Excellence in Summer Service by the Marion County Commission on Youth (MCCOY)!

To be recognized for the work I have done for DNOVA Institute truly inspires me to keep going and never give up. This means a lot to me as it reflects the time and effort I have dedicated to helping those high school students interested in STEM from the summer programs.

A huge thanks to Matt DeLoughery for the nomination, and to the DNOVA team for their incredible support. I’m grateful for the opportunities and lessons I’ve gained through this summer experience; none of it would have been possible without them.

I’m motivated to continue building on this experience and finding new ways to contribute to my community. ❤️

On the 21st of August 2025, I was honored to receive the Certificate of Excellence in Summer Service from the Marion County Commission on Youth (MCCOY) ! 🌟

Being recognized for my work with DirectEmployers Institute inspires me to keep pushing forward and reminds me that the effort I’ve poured into supporting middle school and high school students truly matters. One of the most meaningful parts of this experience is knowing I’ve made my parents proud. ❤️

I’m especially grateful to DirectEmployers Institute for my nomination, and to Simone Murray (CEO) and Imani K M.  (Associate Director) for their guidance and support throughout this journey.

This recognition motivates me to continue learning, growing, and making an impact in my community.

#ExcellenceInService #YouthLeadership #Gratitude

Celebrate Culture at Indianapolis Mariachi and Folklore Festival: Indiana State Museum offers free admission and festivities on Saturday, Aug. 23.

A vibrant celebration of culture and tradition awaits visitors for the Indianapolis Mariachi and Folklore Festival, happening from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. on Aug. 23 at the Indiana State Museum.

Presented by Arte Mexicano en Indiana and Ballet Folklorico Mosaicos in collaboration with the Indiana State Museum,  this free event invites community members to experience a day filled with live music, dance performances, food, vendor booths and family-friendly activities.

Performers from across the Midwest will come together during this festival to highlight the signature sounds and artistic rhythms of Mexican heritage. Visitors can enjoy the music of Florelis Jimenez, Mariachi Internacional de Bloomington, Mariachi Son de Mi Tierra and Mariachi Band Zelaya as well as dance performances by Indy Folklore Academy, Grupo Folklorico Macehuani, Ballet Folklorico Sones Mexicanos and Ballet Folklorico Mosaicos.

“Mariachi and Mexican folkloric dances are not just music and dance,” said Eduardo Luna, Executive Director of Arte Mexicano en Indiana. “They offer a way to connect with family, celebrate traditions, foster community, and identity.”

While visitors take in the performances, they can also savor delicious Mexican street food favorites, including tacos, quesadilla and elotes. Plus, there will be around 30 booths featuring local vendors and community organizations, offering attendees a chance to explore handmade items and connect with local resource providers.

Afterwards, visitors can discover all three floors of museum galleries, including seasonal experiences like Museum Marvels and Amazing Pollinators presented by Corteva Agriscience.

The Indianapolis Mariachi and Folklore Festival is free and open to the public. Visitors can go to IndianaMuseum.org to find more information.

https://lnkd.in/gwtnN3Bq

#WNBAAllStar2025 #empowHER #AllStarIndy #MCCOY#IndyYouth

#WNBAAllStar2025 #FeverOpeningNight #empowHER #AllStarIndy #MCCOY

The empowHER Student Ambassadors came together for a superhero-inspired experience at the Indianapolis Urban League. Through creative challenges and hands-on activities, they explored what it means to lead, support one another, and be a force for good in their communities. 💫🦸🏻♀️
#WNBAAllStar2025 #empowHER #AllStarIndy #MCCOY #IndyYouthInAction

From hanging with the Indiana Fever on opening day to checking out the Indianapolis Motor Speedway, repping International Women's Day at the Indiana State Fairgrounds & Event Center, & visiting Indianapolis Colts admin at the Indiana Farm Bureau Football Center, our WNBA (Women's National Basketball Association) All-Star Indy 2025 Student Ambassadors have met & learned from important, powerful women all year! #WNBAAllStar2025

As part of the Indiana Summer Youth Program, Gleaners Food Bank of Indiana is once again offering its Summer Meals for Kids Program to support families during the summer months. This program provides weekly boxes of healthy, nutritious meals to families of children or youth connected to your organization.

This is a valuable opportunity to help ensure that children and families in your community have access to consistent, wholesome meals while school is out.

The deadline to sign up for this year’s meal box distribution is Friday, May 16th, 2025.
If you would like to participate, please complete and return the paperwork your organization received via email from Lilly Endowment, Inc. to Margo Takehara at mtakehara@gleaners.org prior to the May 16th deadline.

Let’s work together to keep kids nourished and thriving all summer long!

In the summer of 2024, more than 600,000 Hoosier kids received $120 in benefits to help with their families' grocery bills. SNAP benefits don't change in the summer, when kids are home and have a much more difficult time accessing summer meal sites and other programs to fill the gaps usually met by school breakfast, lunch, snacks, and suppers. 

This year, Governor Braun has decided not to participate in this program, that brought more than $70 million in federal funding to low income Hoosier families. This shortsighted move will stretch families' grocery budget even further, and cause kids to miss meals this summer; not a recipe to make Indiana healthier. Contact Governor Braun TODAY to tell him to restore funding for the SUN Bucks federal summer food service program so that kids in Indiana can have increased access to healthy foods over the summer.

Contact the governor: https://lnkd.in/gh_eFd97

Learn more: Feeding Indiana's Hungry, Inc.

The Criminalization of Homelessness is BACK AGAIN for a third time! This legislation failed first in HB 1662 and then in SB 197, and has now been added to HB 1014 with just two days left in the session of the Indiana General Assembly. Please CALL and WRITE ASAP. https://lnkd.in/g53Ap3ZT

The Summer Camp Director Mixer is coming up next week, but that's not all—we have a variety of upcoming programming to help organizations with their summer youth programs and beyond. Discover what's available for you: https://lnkd.in/ge5RKZ3H

Leaders across Marion County are actively looking for young adults previously involved in the juvenile justice system to help us create positive change for today's youth. Learn more, share, & apply: https://lnkd.in/gfM7KNUQ

House Bill 1002, "Various Education Matters," was introduced to deregulate education but has recently received two amendments that will be harmful to the implementation of social and emotional learning. Amendment #19 removes a current requirement that teacher preparation programs provide instruction to teacher candidates on “evidence based social [and] emotional learning classroom practices” that align with the state’s SEL competencies. Amendment 32 will remove behavioral supports in Indiana classrooms and removes "social, emotional, and behavioral functioning" from the state's definition of "school psychology."

These amendments were added without public testimony and the bill is now on its way to the full House chamber for further review.

Please take one minute to take action NOW and let your House representative know that you oppose these amendments to HB1002 to ensure educators receive the training they need to best serve students and that students receive the supports they need to succeed in school and beyond.

TAKE ACTION NOW: https://lnkd.in/g9HE9R9N

Tell Indiana Senators: say NO to Predatory Lending in HB 1174
Unfortunately, HB 1174 is now on the Senate calendar for consideration this Wednesday at 9:30am.

These are the senators who will decide whether or not to move the bill forward:
Senator.Baldwin@iga.in.gov; S31@iga.in.gov; Senator.Alting@iga.in.gov; Senator.Carrasco@iga.in.gov; Senator.Freeman@iga.in.gov; Senator.Gaskill@iga.in.gov; Senator.Schmitt@iga.in.gov; Senator.Randolph@iga.in.gov; Senator.Qaddoura@iga.in.gov

Please considering emailing this group of Senators with a message about HB 1174. #advocacy
